menu.prompt: How would you like to open the Settings app?
menu.choice: Find it in your list of apps
Use the quick settings panel that slides down from the top of your screen
Ask Google to open it for you
Search for it on your phone

recipe.summary: Find and open Settings in your list of apps
recipe.step: Show all your apps
Look for an icon that looks like a gear wheel or cog
The words under it will say "Settings"
Tap once on the Settings icon

recipe.summary: Show all the apps on your phone
recipe.step: Look at your home screen (the main screen with your background picture)
Find a small dot or line at the bottom of the screen, usually in the middle
Put your finger on the dot and slide up towards the top of the screen
If that doesn't work, look for a button with small squares or circles that means "All Apps"

recipe.summary: Open Settings from the panel that slides down
recipe.step: Touch the very top of your screen
Slide your finger down to show some quick settings
Slide down again if you don't see a gear wheel icon
Look for the gear wheel icon (it might be near the bottom)
Tap the gear wheel once to open Settings

recipe.summary: Ask Google to open Settings for you
recipe.step: Say "Hey Google" or "OK Google"
Wait for a sound or colored lights to show Google is listening
Say "Open Settings"
If that doesn't work, try holding down the home button (in the middle at the bottom) and then say "Open Settings"

recipe.summary: Search for the Settings app
recipe.step: Look at your home screen
Find the search bar (usually at the top, it might say "Search phone")
Tap the search bar once
Type in the word "Settings"
Look for the gear wheel icon in the search results
Tap once on Settings when you find it

menu.prompt: Are you having trouble finding Settings?
menu.choice: Get help for your specific phone model
Get help if you can't see the screen well
Ask someone to help you turn on accessibility features

recipe.summary: Get help finding Settings on your specific phone
recipe.step: Look on the back of your phone for the maker's name (like Samsung, Google, or Motorola)
If you can't find it there, try looking under "About phone" if you can get to Settings another way
Get specific help for your phone type

recipe.summary: Get help for different types of phones
recipe.step: For Samsung phones: Look for Settings in the folder called "Samsung"
For Google phones: Swipe up from the bottom and Settings should be in alphabetical order
For Motorola phones: Look for a folder called "Moto" or "Tools"
If you still can't find it, look for your phone's manual online or ask your phone company for help

recipe.summary: Find Settings if you can't see the screen well
recipe.step: Try asking Google: Say "Hey Google, open Settings"
If that doesn't work, ask someone nearby to help you turn on TalkBack
Once TalkBack is on, touch anywhere on the screen and drag your finger until you hear "Settings"
Double-tap when you hear "Settings"

recipe.summary: Get help turning on accessibility features
recipe.step: Ask someone you trust to help you find Settings
Ask them to help you find "Accessibility" in Settings
Have them help you turn on the features you need
Ask them to show you how to get back to Settings later
Practice opening Settings together until you feel comfortable doing it on your own
